It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, lace-like fronds that exhibit a vibrant green coloration. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments and requires high humidity to maintain its delicate structure. Due to its rarity and unique beauty, Chlorospatha giraldoi is often cultivated in specialized botanical gardens.
